statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Justin Robinson scored 19 points and Virginia Tech pulled away in the second half to beat No. 10 North Carolina 80-69 on Monday night.

video.headline: Virginia Tech pulls off upset of North Carolina
video.caption: No. 10 North Carolina struggles on Virginia Tech's home court in front of a sold-out crowd, falling 80-69 to the unranked Hokies on Monday.
video.description: No. 10 North Carolina struggles on Virginia Tech's home court in front of a sold-out crowd, falling 80-69 to the unranked Hokies on Monday.
video.title: Virginia Tech pulls off upset of North Carolina

article.headline: Robinson's 19 lead Hokies past No. 10 UNC, 80-69

images.name: Virginia Tech pulls off upset of North Carolina
images.caption: No. 10 North Carolina struggles on Virginia Tech's home court in front of a sold-out crowd, falling 80-69 to the unranked Hokies on Monday.

article.linkText: Robinson's 19 lead Hokies past No. 10 UNC, 80-69
article.story: BLACKSBURG, Va. -- Kerry Blackshear Jr. called Virginia Tech's game against No. 10 North Carolina a "really big character test," coming on the heels of a loss at home against Florida State. That was a game, Blackshear said, in which the Hokies "really didn't just come to play." They passed this test with flying colors. Justin Robinson scored 19 points, Ahmed Hill had 18 and the Hokies pulled away in the second half to beat the Tar Heels 80-69 on Monday night. Blackshear added 16 points for Virginia Tech (14-6, 3-4 Atlantic Coast Conference), which used a 13-3 run after the Tar Heels closed to within three to open a 64-51 advantage with just under eight minutes remaining. UNC never got closer than eight again. "Today was big for us," Robinson said. "It was a good response." Hill scored the first seven points in the decisive burst and said the Hokies proved they can play defense when they focus on it. "Once we do what the coaches want and what their plan is, we're a great team," he said. It was that defense, Blackshear said, that sparked the run. "We just tried to grind it out. We felt like we had some good possessions. Shots weren't falling, but that's OK," he said. "We just tried to base our momentum on stops and we got a few stops that allowed us to get a couple of transition baskets, allowed us to let our offense start flowing and I felt like we did a good job of just building on both ends of the floor." Joel Berry and Luke Maye scored 23 points each for the Tar Heels (16-5, 5-3). North Carolina turned the ball over 13 times to Virginia Tech's nine, and Virginia Tech outscored them 11-2 off those mistakes. "We have some issues and that's my responsibility," coach Roy Williams said. "I used to say I shouldn't have to coach effort and intensity but I'm trying to coach that and not doing a very good job at it. It's frustrating." The Hokies ended the first half on a 15-2 run to lead 39-32 at the break. Back-to-back 3-pointers by Berry sparked the Tar Heels early in the second half, and they closed to 51-48 with 12:11 to play. Hill's 3-pointer -- one of 12 for the Hokies -- then started his personal 7-0 run. As the final horn sounded, fans that had been chanting "just like football" streamed onto the court. BIG PICTURE North Carolina: The Tar Heels like to play at a fast pace, but were not as adept at getting back on defense against the Hokies, who scored numerous baskets before 10 seconds had come off the shot clock. Virginia Tech: The Hokies are second nationally in field goal percentage at .521, and while they came up short of that against the Tar Heels (30 of 63, 47.6 percent), they outscored North Carolina 32-26 in the paint and outrebounded them 36-35. The Hokies finished with five players with at least five rebounds and had seven different players make at least one 3-pointer. UP NEXT The Tar Heels return home to face North Carolina State on Saturday. Virginia Tech travels to South Bend, Indiana to face Notre Dame on Saturday. --- More AP college basketball: http://collegebasketball.ap.org and http://www.twitter.com/AP-Top25

videos.headline: Maye hits triple for 10 early points
videos.description: Luke Maye drills a 3-pointer for his 10th point and is now 4-of-4 from the field against Virginia Tech.

videos.headline: Hokies honor Beamer
videos.description: Virginia Tech fans applaud Frank Beamer for his induction into the College Football Hall of Fame during the UNC game.

videos.headline: Hokies capitalize on Tar Heel turnover with two-handed jam
videos.description: Chris Clarke intercepts Theo Pinson's bad pass and speeds down the court for a sweet dunk against UNC.

videos.headline: Virginia Tech's Alexander-Walker creates tough 3-point play
videos.description: Nickeil Alexander-Walker takes some fancy steps to the basket and finishes for and-1 in the first half.

videos.headline: Hokies' Bede finishes with 3-pointer after nice play
videos.description: After the Tar Heels turn it over, Kerry Blackshear Jr. finds Wabissa Bede who hits a triple to tie the game at 30-30 in the first half.

videos.headline: Williams breaks down first half
videos.description: A heated up Buzz Williams explains how the Hokies dominated offensively in the last 5 minutes of the first half against the Tar Heels.

videos.headline: Hokies' Robinson hits tough 3 at the end of the half
videos.description: Justin Robinson drills a triple with a second left on the shot clock to give Virginia Tech a 7-point lead against UNC.

videos.headline: Roy explains Tar Heels' first-half struggles
videos.description: North Carolina head coach Roy Williams says his team didn't guard the Hokies nearly enough in the first half.

videos.headline: Berry hits back-to-back triples
videos.description: Joel Berry II buries two 3-pointers to shrink the Tar Heels deficit against the Hokies early in the second half.

videos.headline: Manley's block leads to UNC bucket
videos.description: Sterling Manley rises up to block Justin Robinson's layup then Theo Pinson finds Luke Maye at the other end and he makes a nice basket for the Tar Heels.

videos.headline: Robinson sends slick pass to Blackshear for Hokies' layup
videos.description: Justin Robinson somehow finds Kerry Blackshear Jr. through three UNC defenders and puts in the layup.

videos.headline: Hill throws down impressive putback dunk
videos.description: Justin Robinson speeds down the court and misses the layup, but Ahmed Hill elevates up to slam it home for the Hokies.

videos.headline: Hill hits corner 3 to extend Hokies' lead
videos.description: Justin Bibbs dishes it to Ahmed Hill who sinks the 3-pointer from the right corner to give Virginia Tech a 14-point lead against UNC with less than 5 minutes left in the game.

videos.headline: Hokie fans storm court after upsetting No. 10 North Carolina
videos.description: Fans quickly leave the stands and rush to the court immediately following Virginia Tech's 80-69 victory over UNC.

videos.headline: Williams proud of team
videos.description: Buzz Williams says Monday night's victory over the Tar Heels says a lot about his team and thinks it has a chance to beat Notre Dame later on this week.
